text: The mice and the weasels were in constant war. The mice, who were always defeated, gathered in assembly, and thinking it was because of a lack of bosses they always lost, they appointed several strategists. The newly elected chiefs, wanting to dazzle and distinguish themselves from the common soldiers, made themselves a kind of horns and held them tightly. The next great battle came, and as always, the army of mice lost. And all the mice fled into their holes, and the chief ones, being unable to enter because of their horns, were caught and devoured. Power does not involve vanity, but responsibility.
title: Los ratones y las comadrejas
author: nan Esopo
